text: L. Desaix Anderson (1936 – February 11, 2021) was an American politician and United States Foreign Service officer. His works focused in East Asian affairs. He was American Chargé d'Affaires ad interim to Vietnam from 1995 until 1997 during the Bill Clinton presidency. Anderson was born in Sumner, Mississippi.Desaix Anderson Biographic Sketch Institute for Corean-American Studies, retrieved 2008-04-22 Anderson died on February 11, 2021 at the age of 84.The Mansfield Foundation Mourns Desaix Anderson (1936-2021) ==References== ==Other websites== * L.
